alias=\"arrow_forward\"\u003e▶️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e How is \u003cb\u003eSeleniumBase\u003c/b\u003e different from raw Selenium? (\u003cb\u003eclick to expand\u003c/b\u003e)\u003c/summary\u003e\n\u003cdiv dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase is a Python framework for browser automation and testing. SeleniumBase uses \u003ca href=\"https://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver2/#endpoints\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eSelenium/WebDriver\u003c/a\u003e APIs and incorporates test-runners such as \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003epynose\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003ebehave\u003c/code\u003e to provide organized structure, test discovery, test execution, test state (\u003ci\u003eeg. passed, failed, or skipped\u003c/i\u003e), and command-line options for changing default settings (\u003ci\u003eeg. browser selection\u003c/i\u003e). With raw Selenium, you would need to set up your own options-parser for configuring tests from the command-line.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase's driver manager gives you more control over automatic driver downloads. (Use \u003ccode\u003e--driver-version=VER\u003c/code\u003e with your \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e run command to specify the version.) By default, SeleniumBase will download a driver version that matches your major browser version if not set.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase automatically detects between CSS Selectors and XPath, which means you don't need to specify the type of selector in your commands (\u003ci\u003ebut optionally you could\u003c/i\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase methods often perform multiple actions in a single method call. For example, \u003ccode\u003eself.type(selector, text)\u003c/code\u003e does the following:\u003cbr\u003e1. Waits for the element to be visible.\u003cbr\u003e2. Waits for the element to be interactive.\u003cbr\u003e3. Clears the text field.\u003cbr\u003e4. Types in the new text.\u003cbr\u003e5. Presses Enter/Submit if the text ends in \u003ccode\u003e\"\\n\"\u003c/code\u003e.\u003cbr\u003eWith raw Selenium, those actions require multiple method calls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase uses default timeout values when not set:\u003cbr\u003e\n✅ \u003ccode\u003eself.click(\"button\")\u003c/code\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\nWith raw Selenium, methods would fail instantly (\u003ci\u003eby default\u003c/i\u003e) if an element needed more time to load:\u003cbr\u003e\n❌ \u003ccode\u003eself.driver.find_element(by=\"css selector\", value=\"button\").click()\u003c/code\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n(Reliable code is better than unreliable code.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase lets you change the explicit timeout values of methods:\u003cbr\u003e\n✅ \u003ccode\u003eself.click(\"button\", timeout=10)\u003c/code\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\nWith raw Selenium, that requires more code:\u003cbr\u003e\n❌ \u003ccode\u003eWebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.element_to_be_clickable(\"css selector\", \"button\")).click()\u003c/code\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n(Simple code is better than complex code.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase gives you clean error output when a test fails. With raw Selenium, error messages can get very messy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase gives you the option to generate a dashboard and reports for tests. It also saves screenshots from failing tests to the \u003ccode\u003e./latest_logs/\u003c/code\u003e folder. Raw \u003ca href=\"https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/webdriver/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eSelenium\u003c/a\u003e does not have these options out-of-the-box.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase includes desktop GUI apps for running tests, such as \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/commander.md\"\u003eSeleniumBase Commander\u003c/a\u003e for \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/behave_bdd/ReadMe.md\"\u003eSeleniumBase Behave GUI\u003c/a\u003e for \u003ccode\u003ebehave\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase has its own \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/recorder_mode.md\"\u003eRecorder / Test Generator\u003c/a\u003e for creating tests from manual browser actions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase comes with \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/case_plans.md\"\u003etest case management software, (\"CasePlans\")\u003c/a\u003e, for organizing tests and step descriptions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e💡 SeleniumBase includes tools for \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/chart_maker/ReadMe.md\"\u003ebuilding data apps, (\"ChartMaker\")\u003c/a\u003e, which can generate JavaScript from Python.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/details\u003e\n\u003chr\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e📚 \u003cb\u003eLearn about different ways of writing tests:\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp align=\"left\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e📘📝 Here's \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/test_simple_login.py\"\u003etest_simple_login.py\u003c/a\u003e, which uses \u003ccode\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/fixtures/base_case.py\"\u003eBaseCase\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/code\u003e class inheritance, and runs with \u003ca href=\"https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/how-to/usage.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003epytest\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/mdmintz/pynose\"\u003epynose\u003c/a\u003e. (Use \u003ccode\u003eself.driver\u003c/code\u003e to access Selenium's raw \u003ccode\u003edriver\u003c/code\u003e.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate self.type(\u0026quot;#password\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;secret_pass\u0026quot;)\n        self.click('a:contains(\u0026quot;Sign in\u0026quot;)')\n        self.assert_exact_text(\u0026quot;Welcome!\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;h1\u0026quot;)\n        self.assert_element(\u0026quot;img#image1\u0026quot;)\n        self.highlight(\u0026quot;#image1\u0026quot;)\n        self.click_link(\u0026quot;Sign out\u0026quot;)\n        self.assert_text(\u0026quot;signed out\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;#top_message\u0026quot;)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eTestSimpleLogin\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eBaseCase\u003c/span\u003e):\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003edef\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003etest_simple_login\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e):\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"self.open(url)  # Navigate the browser window to the URL.\nself.type(selector, text)  # Update the field with the text.\nself.click(selector)  # Click the element with the selector.\nself.click_link(link_text)  # Click the link containing text.\nself.go_back()  # Navigate back to the previous URL.\nself.select_option_by_text(dropdown_selector, option)\nself.hover_and_click(hover_selector, click_selector)\nself.drag_and_drop(drag_selector, drop_selector)\nself.get_text(selector)  # Get the text from the element.\nself.get_current_url()  # Get the URL of the current page.\nself.get_page_source()  # Get the HTML of the current page.\nself.get_attribute(selector, attribute)  # Get element attribute.\nself.get_title()  # Get the title of the current page.\nself.switch_to_frame(frame)  # Switch into the iframe container.\nself.switch_to_default_content()  # Leave the iframe container.\nself.open_new_window()  # Open a new window in the same browser.\nself.switch_to_window(window)  # Switch to the browser window.\nself.switch_to_default_window()  # Switch to the original window.\nself.get_new_driver(OPTIONS)  # Open a new driver with OPTIONS.\nself.switch_to_driver(driver)  # Switch to the browser driver.\nself.switch_to_default_driver()  # Switch to the original driver.\nself.wait_for_element(selector)  # Wait until element is visible.\nself.is_element_visible(selector)  # Return element visibility.\nself.is_text_visible(text, selector)  # Return text visibility.\nself.sleep(seconds)  # Do nothing for the given amount of time.\nself.save_screenshot(name)  # Save a screenshot in .png format.\nself.assert_element(selector)  # Verify the element is visible.\nself.assert_text(text, selector)  # Verify text in the element.\nself.assert_exact_text(text, selector)  # Verify text is exact.\nself.assert_title(title)  # Verify the title of the web page.\nself.assert_downloaded_file(file)  # Verify file was downloaded.\nself.assert_no_404_errors()  # Verify there are no broken links.\nself.assert_no_js_errors()  # Verify there are no JS errors.\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan closing web browsers after tests.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ SeleniumBase lets you customize tests via \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/customizing_test_runs.md\"\u003ecommand-line options\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ SeleniumBase uses simple syntax for commands. Example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"self.type(\u0026quot;input\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;dogs\\n\u0026quot;)  # (The \u0026quot;\\n\u0026quot; presses ENTER)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003etype\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"input\"\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"dogs\u003cspan class=\"pl-cce\"\u003e\\n\u003c/span\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e)  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# (The \"\\n\" presses ENTER)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eMost SeleniumBase scripts can be run with \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003epynose\u003c/code\u003e, or pure \u003ccode\u003epython\u003c/code\u003e. Not all test runners can run all test formats. For example, tests that use the \u003ccode\u003esb\u003c/code\u003e pytest fixture can only be run with \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e. (See \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/syntax_formats.md\"\u003eSyntax Formats\u003c/a\u003e) There's also a \u003ca href=\"https://behave.readthedocs.io/en/stable/gherkin.html#features\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eGherkin\u003c/a\u003e test format that runs with \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/behave_bdd/ReadMe.md\"\u003ebehave\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest coffee_cart_tests.py --rs\npytest test_sb_fixture.py --demo\npytest test_suite.py --rs --html=report.html --dashboard\n\npynose basic_test.py --mobile\npynose test_suite.py --headless --report --show-report\n\npython raw_sb.py\npython raw_test_scripts.py\n\nbehave realworld.feature\nbehave calculator.feature -D rs -D dashboard\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest coffee_cart_tests.py --rs\npytest test_sb_fixture.py --demo\npytest test_suite.py --rs --html=report.html --dashboard\n\npynose basic_test.py --mobile\npynose test_suite.py --headless --report --show-report\n\npython raw_sb.py\npython raw_test_scripts.py\n\nbehave realworld.feature\nbehave calculator.feature -D rs -D dashboard\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e includes automatic test discovery. If you don't specify a specific file or folder to run, \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e will automatically search through all subdirectories for tests to run based on the following criteria:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePython files that start with \u003ccode\u003etest_\u003c/code\u003e or end with \u003ccode\u003e_test.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePython methods that start with \u003ccode\u003etest_\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWith a SeleniumBase \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/pytest.ini\"\u003epytest.ini\u003c/a\u003e file present, you can modify default discovery settings. The Python class name can be anything because \u003ccode\u003eseleniumbase.BaseCase\u003c/code\u003e inherits \u003ccode\u003eunittest.TestCase\u003c/code\u003e to trigger autodiscovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ You can do a pre-flight check to see which tests would get discovered by \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e before the actual run:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest --co -q\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest --co -q\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ You can be more specific when calling \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003epynose\u003c/code\u003e on a file:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest [FILE_NAME.py]::[CLASS_NAME]::[METHOD_NAME]\n\npynose [FILE_NAME.py]:[CLASS_NAME].[METHOD_NAME]\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest [FILE_NAME.py]::[CLASS_NAME]::[METHOD_NAME]\n\npynose [FILE_NAME.py]:[CLASS_NAME].[METHOD_NAME]\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ No More Flaky Tests! SeleniumBase methods automatically wait for page elements to finish loading before interacting with them (\u003ci\u003eup to a timeout limit\u003c/i\u003e). This means \u003cb\u003eyou no longer need random \u003cspan\u003e\u003ccode\u003etime.sleep()\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/span\u003e statements\u003c/b\u003e in your scripts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp is doing. If a test is moving too fast for your eyes, run it in \u003cb\u003eDemo Mode\u003c/b\u003e to pause the browser briefly between actions, highlight page elements being acted on, and display assertions:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest my_first_test.py --demo\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest my_first_test.py --demo\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 \u003ccode\u003etime.sleep(seconds)\u003c/code\u003e can be used to make a test wait at a specific spot:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"import time; time.sleep(3)  # Do nothing for 3 seconds.\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etime\u003c/span\u003e; \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etime\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003esleep\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e3\u003c/span\u003e)  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# Do nothing for 3 seconds.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 \u003cstrong\u003eDebug Mode\u003c/strong\u003e with Python's built-in \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://docs.python.org/3/library/pdb.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003epdb\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e library helps you debug tests:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"import pdb; pdb.set_trace()\nimport pytest; pytest.set_trace()\nbreakpoint()  # Shortcut for \u0026quot;import pdb; pdb.set_trace()\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003epdb\u003c/span\u003e; \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003epdb\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eset_trace\u003c/span\u003e()\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003epytest\u003c/span\u003e; \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003epytest\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eset_trace\u003c/span\u003e()\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ebreakpoint\u003c/span\u003e()  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# Shortcut for \"import pdb; pdb.set_trace()\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e(\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003epdb\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e commands: \u003ccode\u003en\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ec\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003es\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eu\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ed\u003c/code\u003e =\u0026gt; \u003ccode\u003enext\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003econtinue\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estep\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eup\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edown\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 To pause an active test that throws an exception or error, (\u003cem\u003eand keep the browser window open while \u003cstrong\u003eDebug Mode\u003c/strong\u003e begins in the console\u003c/em\u003e), add \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003e--pdb\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e as a \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e option:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest test_fail.py --pdb\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest test_fail.py --pdb\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 To start tests in Debug Mode, add \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003e--trace\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e as a \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e option:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-pytest_options\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n✅ Here are some useful command-line options that come with \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"-v  # Verbose mode. Prints the full name of each test and shows more details.\n-q  # Quiet mode. Print fewer details in the console output when running tests.\n-x  # Stop running the tests after the first failure is reached.\n--html=report.html  # Creates a detailed pytest-html report after tests finish.\n--co | --collect-only  # Show what tests would get run. (Without running them)\n--co -q  # (Both options together!) - Do a dry run with full test names shown.\n-n=NUM  # Multithread the tests using that many threads. (Speed up test runs!)\n-s  # See print statements. (Should be on by default with pytest.ini present.)\n--junit-xml=report.xml  # Creates a junit-xml report after tests finish.\n--pdb  # If a test fails, enter Post Mortem Debug Mode. (Don't use with CI!)\n--trace  # Enter Debug Mode at the beginning of each test. (Don't use with CI!)\n-m=MARKER  # Run tests with the specified pytest marker.\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e-v  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Verbose mode. Prints the full name of each test and shows more details.\u003c/span\u003e\n-q  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Quiet mode. Print fewer details in the console output when running tests.\u003c/span\u003e\n-x  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Stop running the tests after the first failure is reached.\u003c/span\u003e\n--html=report.html  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Creates a detailed pytest-html report after tests finish.\u003c/span\u003e\n--co \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e|\u003c/span\u003e --collect-only  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Show what tests would get run. (Without running them)\u003c/span\u003e\n--co -q  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Both options together!) - Do a dry run with full test names shown.\u003c/span\u003e\n-n=NUM  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Multithread the tests using that many threads. (Speed up test runs!)\u003c/span\u003e\n-s  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e See print statements. (Should be on by default with pytest.ini present.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--junit-xml=report.xml  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Creates a junit-xml report after tests finish.\u003c/span\u003e\n--pdb  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e If a test fails, enter Post Mortem Debug Mode. (Don't use with CI!)\u003c/span\u003e\n--trace  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Enter Debug Mode at the beginning of each test. (Don't use with CI!)\u003c/span\u003e\n-m=MARKER  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e Run tests with the specified pytest marker.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-new_pytest_options\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n✅ SeleniumBase provides additional \u003ccode\u003epytest\u003c/code\u003e command-line options for tests:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--browser=BROWSER  # (The web browser to use. Default: \u0026quot;chrome\u0026quot;.)\n--chrome  # (Shortcut for \u0026quot;--browser=chrome\u0026quot;. On by default.)\n--edge  # (Shortcut for \u0026quot;--browser=edge\u0026quot;.)\n--firefox  # (Shortcut for \u0026quot;--browser=firefox\u0026quot;.)\n--safari  # (Shortcut for \u0026quot;--browser=safari\u0026quot;.)\n--settings-file=FILE  # (Override default SeleniumBase settings.)\n--env=ENV  # (Set the test env. Access with \u0026quot;self.env\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--account=STR  # (Set account. Access with \u0026quot;self.account\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--data=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with \u0026quot;self.data\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--var1=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with \u0026quot;self.var1\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--var2=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with \u0026quot;self.var2\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--var3=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with \u0026quot;self.var3\u0026quot; in tests.)\n--variables=DICT  # (Extra test data. Access with \u0026quot;self.variables\u0026quot;.)\n--user-data-dir=DIR  # (Set the Chrome user data directory to use.)\n--protocol=PROTOCOL  # (The Selenium Grid protocol: http|https.)\n--server=SERVER  # (The Selenium Grid server/IP used for tests.)\n--port=PORT  # (The Selenium Grid port used by the test server.)\n--cap-file=FILE  # (The web browser's desired capabilities to use.)\n--cap-string=STRING  # (The web browser's desired capabilities to use.)\n--proxy=SERVER:PORT  # (Connect to a proxy server:port as tests are running)\n--proxy=USERNAME:PASSWORD@SERVER:PORT  # (Use an authenticated proxy server)\n--proxy-bypass-list=STRING # (\u0026quot;;\u0026quot;-separated hosts to bypass, Eg \u0026quot;*.foo.com\u0026quot;)\n--proxy-pac-url=URL  # (Connect to a proxy server using a PAC_URL.pac file.)\n--proxy-pac-url=USERNAME:PASSWORD@URL  # (Authenticated proxy with PAC URL.)\n--proxy-driver  # (If a driver download is needed, will use: --proxy=PROXY.)\n--multi-proxy  # (Allow multiple authenticated proxies when multi-threaded.)\n--agent=STRING  # (Modify the web browser's User-Agent string.)\n--mobile  # (Use the mobile device emulator while running tests.)\n--metrics=STRING  # (Set mobile metrics: \u0026quot;CSSWidth,CSSHeight,PixelRatio\u0026quot;.)\n--chromium-arg=\u0026quot;ARG=N,ARG2\u0026quot;  # (Set Chromium args, \u0026quot;,\u0026quot;-separated, no spaces.)\n--firefox-arg=\u0026quot;ARG=N,ARG2\u0026quot;  # (Set Firefox args, comma-separated, no spaces.)\n--firefox-pref=SET  # (Set a Firefox preference:value set, comma-separated.)\n--extension-zip=ZIP  # (Load a Chrome Extension .zip|.crx, comma-separated.)\n--extension-dir=DIR  # (Load a Chrome Extension directory, comma-separated.)\n--disable-features=\u0026quot;F1,F2\u0026quot;  # (Disable features, comma-separated, no spaces.)\n--binary-location=PATH  # (Set path of the Chromium browser binary to use.)\n--driver-version=VER  # (Set the chromedriver or uc_driver version to use.)\n--sjw  # (Skip JS Waits for readyState to be \u0026quot;complete\u0026quot; or Angular to load.)\n--pls=PLS  # (Set pageLoadStrategy on Chrome: \u0026quot;normal\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;eager\u0026quot;, or \u0026quot;none\u0026quot;.)\n--headless  # (Run tests in headless mode. The default arg on Linux OS.)\n--headless2  # (Use the new headless mode, which supports extensions.)\n--headed  # (Run tests in headed/GUI mode on Linux OS, where not default.)\n--xvfb  # (Run tests using the Xvfb virtual display server on Linux OS.)\n--locale=LOCALE_CODE  # (Set the Language Locale Code for the web browser.)\n--interval=SECONDS  # (The autoplay interval for presentations \u0026amp; tour steps)\n--start-page=URL  # (The starting URL for the web browser when tests begin.)\n--archive-logs  # (Archive existing log files instead of deleting them.)\n--archive-downloads  # (Archive old downloads instead of deleting them.)\n--time-limit=SECONDS  # (Safely fail any test that exceeds the time limit.)\n--slow  # (Slow down the automation. size.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--maximize  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Start tests with the browser window maximized.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--screenshot  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Save a screenshot at the end of each test.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--no-screenshot  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (No screenshots saved unless tests directly ask it.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--visual-baseline  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Set the visual baseline for Visual/Layout tests.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--wire  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Use selenium-wire's webdriver for replacing selenium webdriver.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--external-pdf  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e#\u003c/span\u003e (Set Chromium \"plugins.always_open_pdf_externally\":True.)\u003c/span\u003e\n--timeout-multiplier=MULTIPLIER  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e\u003cspan (After each failing test, list the URL of the failure.)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e(See the full list of command-line option definitions \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/plugins/pytest_plugin.py\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e. For detailed examples of command-line options, see \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/customizing_test_runs.md\"\u003ecustomizing_test_runs.md\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003chr\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 During test failures, logs and screenshots from the most recent test run will get saved to the \u003ccode\u003elatest_logs/\u003c/code\u003e folder. Those logs will get moved to \u003ccode\u003earchived_logs/\u003c/code\u003e if you add --archive_logs to command-line options, or have \u003ccode\u003eARCHIVE_EXISTING_LOGS\u003c/code\u003e set to True in \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/settings.py\"\u003esettings.py\u003c/a\u003e, otherwise log files with be cleaned up at the start of the next test run. The \u003ccode\u003etest_suite.py\u003c/code\u003e collection contains tests that fail on purpose so that you can see how logging works.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"cd examples/\n\npytest test_suite.py --chrome\n\npytest test_suite.py --firefox\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ecd\u003c/span\u003e examples/\n\npytest test_suite.py --chrome\n\npytest test_suite.py --firefox\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAn easy way to override seleniumbase/config/settings.py is by using a custom settings file.\nHere's the command-line option to add to tests: (See \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/custom_settings.py\"\u003eexamples/custom_settings.py\u003c/a\u003e)\n\u003ccode\u003e--settings_file=custom_settings.py\u003c/code\u003e\n(Settings include default timeout values, a two-factor auth key, DB credentials, S3 credentials, and other important settings used by tests.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 To pass additional data from the command-line to tests, add \u003ccode\u003e--data=\"ANY STRING\"\u003c/code\u003e.\nInside your tests, you can use \u003ccode\u003eself.data\u003c/code\u003e to access These files specify default configuration details for tests. Test folders should also include a blank \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/offline_examples/__init__.py\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einit\u003c/strong\u003e.py\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e file to allow your test files to import other files from that folder.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 \u003ccode\u003esbase mkdir DIR\u003c/code\u003e creates a folder with config files and sample pytest generates a SeleniumBase Dashboard located at \u003ccode\u003edashboard.html\u003c/code\u003e, which updates automatically as tests run and produce results. Example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest --dashboard --rs --headless\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest --dashboard --rs --headless\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d3362b2f52ebc4545d89b8c8418402d2b39990a1c218fb2038573bf5e4983e60/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f64617368626f6172645f312e706e67\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d3362b2f52ebc4545d89b8c8418402d2b39990a1c218fb2038573bf5e4983e60/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f64617368626f6172645f312e706e67\" alt=\"The SeleniumBase Dashboard\" title=\"The SeleniumBase Dashboard\" width=\"380\" data-canonical-src=\"https://seleniumbase.github.io/cdn/img/dashboard_1.png\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 Additionally, you can host your own SeleniumBase Dashboard Server on a port of your choice. Here's an example of that using Python's \u003ccode\u003ehttp.server\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"python -m http.server 1948\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epython -m http.server 1948\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 Now you can navigate to \u003ccode\u003ehttp://localhost:1948/dashboard.html\u003c/code\u003e in order to view the dashboard as a web app. This requires two different terminal windows: one for running the server, and another for running the tests, which should be run from the same directory. (Use \u003ckbd\u003eCtrl+C\u003c/kbd\u003e to stop the http server.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 Here's a full example of what the SeleniumBase Dashboard may look Additionally, if you set the html report URL to be the same as the Dashboard URL when also using the dashboard, (example: \u003ccode\u003e--dashboard --html=dashboard.html\u003c/code\u003e), then the Dashboard will become an advanced html report when all the tests complete.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e✅ Here's an example of an upgraded html report:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest test_suite.py --dashboard --html=report.html\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest test_suite.py --dashboard --html=report.html\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e74185ef8eeb167f31b51b7aa3dbd8ebd8c21d5a876776162e1042c239b4367b/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f646173685f7265706f72742e6a7067\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e74185ef8eeb167f31b51b7aa3dbd8ebd8c21d5a876776162e1042c239b4367b/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f646173685f7265706f72742e6a7067\" alt=\"Dashboard Pytest HTML Report\" title=\"Dashboard Pytest HTML Report\" width=\"520\" data-canonical-src=\"https://seleniumbase.github.io/cdn/img/dash_report.jpg\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf viewing pytest html reports in \u003ca href=\"https://www.jenkins.io/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eJenkins\u003c/a\u003e, you may need to \u003ca href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/a/46197356\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003econfigure Jenkins settings\u003c/a\u003e for the html to render correctly. pop-ups. \u003ccode\u003eself.dismiss_alert()\u003c/code\u003e automatically waits for and dismisses alert pop-ups. On occasion, some methods like \u003ccode\u003eself.click(SELECTOR)\u003c/code\u003e might dismiss a pop-up on its own because they call JavaScript to make sure that the \u003ccode\u003ereadyState\u003c/code\u003e of the page is \u003ccode\u003ecomplete\u003c/code\u003e before advancing. If you're trying to accept a pop-up that got dismissed this way, use this workaround: Call \u003ccode\u003eself.find_element(SELECTOR).click()\u003c/code\u003e instead, (which will let the pop-up remain on the screen), and then use \u003ccode\u003eself.accept_alert()\u003c/code\u003e to accept the pop-up (\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/issues/600#issuecomment-647270426\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/issues/600/hovercard\"\u003emore on that here\u003c/a\u003e). If pop-ups are intermittent, wrap code in a try/except block.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" Integrations:\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content--production-environments--integrations\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink:  Production Environments \u0026amp; Integrations:\" href=\"#-production-environments--integrations\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdetails\u003e\n\u003csummary\u003e \u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"arrow_forward\"\u003e▶️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e Here are some things you can do to set up a production environment for your testing. (\u003cb\u003eclick to expand\u003c/b\u003e)\u003c/summary\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can set up a \u003ca href=\"https://jenkins.io/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eJenkins\u003c/a\u003e build server for running tests at regular intervals. For a real-world Jenkins example of headless browser automation in action, check out the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/integrations/azure/jenkins/ReadMe.md\"\u003eSeleniumBase Jenkins example on Azure\u003c/a\u003e or the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/integrations/google_cloud/ReadMe.md\"\u003eSeleniumBase Jenkins example on Google Cloud\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can use \u003ca href=\"https://selenium.dev/documentation/en/grid/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ethe Selenium Grid\u003c/a\u003e to scale your testing by distributing tests on several machines with parallel execution. To do this, check out the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/tree/master/seleniumbase/utilities/selenium_grid\"\u003eSeleniumBase selenium_grid folder\u003c/a\u003e, which should have everything you need, including the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/utilities/selenium_grid/ReadMe.md\"\u003eSelenium Grid ReadMe\u003c/a\u003e to help you get started.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you're using the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/mysql_installation.md\"\u003eSeleniumBase MySQL feature\u003c/a\u003e to save results from tests running on a server machine, you can install \u003ca href=\"https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/tools/workbench/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMySQL Workbench\u003c/a\u003e to help you read \u0026amp; write from your DB more easily.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you're using AWS, you can set up an \u003ca href=\"https://aws.amazon.com/s3/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAmazon S3\u003c/a\u003e account for saving log files and screenshots from your tests. To activate this feature, modify \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/settings.py\"\u003esettings.py\u003c/a\u003e with connection details in the S3 section, and add \u003ccode\u003e--with-s3-logging\u003c/code\u003e on the command-line when running your tests.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eHere's an example of running tests with some additional features enabled:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"pytest [YOUR_TEST_FILE.py] --with-db-reporting --with-s3-logging\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003epytest [YOUR_TEST_FILE.py] --with-db-reporting --with-s3-logging\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/details\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca This switches to the new tab (0 is the first one)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_window\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e1\u003c/span\u003e)  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# This switches to the new tab (0 is the first one)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 How to handle iframes:\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content--how-to-handle-iframes\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: 🔵 How to handle iframes:\" href=\"#-how-to-handle-iframes\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 \u003cb\u003eiframes\u003c/b\u003e follow the same principle as new windows: You must first switch to the iframe if you want to perform actions in there:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"self.switch_to_frame(\u0026quot;iframe\u0026quot;)\n# ... Now perform actions inside the iframe\nself.switch_to_parent_frame()  # Exit the current iframe\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_frame\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"iframe\"\u003c/span\u003e)\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# ... Now perform actions inside the iframe\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_parent_frame\u003c/span\u003e()  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# Exit the current iframe\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo exit from multiple iframes, use \u003ccode\u003eself.switch_to_default_content()\u003c/code\u003e. (If inside a single iframe, this has the same effect as \u003ccode\u003eself.switch_to_parent_frame()\u003c/code\u003e.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"self.switch_to_frame('iframe[name=\u0026quot;frame1\u0026quot;]')\nself.switch_to_frame('iframe[name=\u0026quot;frame2\u0026quot;]')\n# ... Now perform actions inside the inner iframe\nself.switch_to_default_content()  # Back to the main page\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_frame\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'iframe[name=\"frame1\"]'\u003c/span\u003e)\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_frame\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'iframe[name=\"frame2\"]'\u003c/span\u003e)\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# ... Now perform actions inside the inner iframe\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eswitch_to_default_content\u003c/span\u003e()  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# Back to the main page\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🔵 You can also use a context manager to act inside iframes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"with self.frame_switch(\u0026quot;iframe\u0026quot;):\n    # ... Now perform actions while inside the code block\n# You have left the iframe\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003ewith\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eframe_switch\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"iframe\"\u003c/span\u003e):\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# ... Now perform actions while inside the code block\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# You have left the iframe\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis also works with nested iframes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"with self.frame_switch('iframe[name=\u0026quot;frame1\u0026quot;]'):\n    with self.frame_switch('iframe[name=\u0026quot;frame2\u0026quot;]'):\n        # ... Now perform actions while inside the code block\n    # You are now back inside the first iframe\n# You have left all the iframes\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003ewith\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eframe_switch\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'iframe[name=\"frame1\"]'\u003c/span\u003e):\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003ewith\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eframe_switch\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'iframe[name=\"frame2\"]'\u003c/span\u003e):\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# ... Now perform actions while inside the code block\u003c/span\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# You are now back inside the first iframe\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# You have left all the iframes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" don't want the test to fail until you verified several elements at once so that you don't have to rerun the test to find more missing elements on the same page. That's where deferred asserts come in. Here's an example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"from seleniumbase import BaseCase\nBaseCase.main(__name__, __file__)\n\nclass DeferredAssertTests(BaseCase):\n    def test_deferred_asserts(self):\n        self.open(\u0026quot;https://xkcd.com/993/\u0026quot;)\n        self.wait_for_element(\u0026quot;#comic\u0026quot;)\n        self.deferred_assert_element('img[alt=\u0026quot;Brand Identity\u0026quot;]')\n        self.deferred_assert_element('img[alt=\u0026quot;Rocket Ship\u0026quot;]')  # Will Fail\n        self.deferred_assert_element(\u0026quot;#comicmap\u0026quot;)\n        self.deferred_assert_text(\u0026quot;Fake Item\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;ul.comicNav\u0026quot;)  # Will Fail\n        self.deferred_assert_text(\u0026quot;Random\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;ul.comicNav\u0026quot;)\n        self.deferred_assert_element('a[name=\u0026quot;Super Fake !!!\u0026quot;]')  # Will Fail\n        self.deferred_assert_exact_text(\u0026quot;Brand Identity\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;#ctitle\u0026quot;)\n        self.deferred_assert_exact_text(\u0026quot;Fake Food\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;#comic\u0026quot;)  # Will Fail\n        self.process_deferred_asserts()\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efrom\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eseleniumbase\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan \u003ccode\u003edeferred_assert_text()\u003c/code\u003e will save any exceptions that would be raised.\nTo flush out all the failed deferred asserts into a single exception, make sure to call alias="arrow_forward">▶️</g-emoji> How is <b>SeleniumBase</b> different from raw Selenium? (<b>click to expand</b>)</summary><div dir="auto"><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase is a Python framework for browser automation and testing. SeleniumBase uses <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver2/#endpoints" rel="nofollow">Selenium/WebDriver</a> APIs and incorporates test-runners such as <code>pytest</code>, <code>pynose</code>, and <code>behave</code> to provide organized structure, test discovery, test execution, test state (<i>eg. passed, failed, or skipped</i>), and command-line options for changing default settings (<i>eg. browser selection</i>). With raw Selenium, you would need to set up your own options-parser for configuring tests from the command-line.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase's driver manager gives you more control over automatic driver downloads. (Use <code>--driver-version=VER</code> with your <code>pytest</code> run command to specify the version.) By default, SeleniumBase will download a driver version that matches your major browser version if not set.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase automatically detects between CSS Selectors and XPath, which means you don't need to specify the type of selector in your commands (<i>but optionally you could</i>).</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase methods often perform multiple actions in a single method call. For example, <code>self.type(selector, text)</code> does the following:<br>1. Waits for the element to be visible.<br>2. Waits for the element to be interactive.<br>3. Clears the text field.<br>4. Types in the new text.<br>5. Presses Enter/Submit if the text ends in <code>"\n"</code>.<br>With raw Selenium, those actions require multiple method calls.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase uses default timeout values when not set:<br>✅ <code>self.click("button")</code><br>With raw Selenium, methods would fail instantly (<i>by default</i>) if an element needed more time to load:<br>❌ <code>self.driver.find_element(by="css selector", value="button").click()</code><br>(Reliable code is better than unreliable code.)</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase lets you change the explicit timeout values of methods:<br>✅ <code>self.click("button", timeout=10)</code><br>With raw Selenium, that requires more code:<br>❌ <code>WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.element_to_be_clickable("css selector", "button")).click()</code><br>(Simple code is better than complex code.)</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase gives you clean error output when a test fails. With raw Selenium, error messages can get very messy.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase gives you the option to generate a dashboard and reports for tests. It also saves screenshots from failing tests to the <code>./latest_logs/</code> folder. Raw <a href="https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/webdriver/" rel="nofollow">Selenium</a> does not have these options out-of-the-box.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase includes desktop GUI apps for running tests, such as <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/commander.md">SeleniumBase Commander</a> for <code>pytest</code> and <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/behave_bdd/ReadMe.md">SeleniumBase Behave GUI</a> for <code>behave</code>.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase has its own <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/recorder_mode.md">Recorder / Test Generator</a> for creating tests from manual browser actions.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase comes with <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/case_plans.md">test case management software, ("CasePlans")</a>, for organizing tests and step descriptions.</p><p dir="auto">💡 SeleniumBase includes tools for <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/chart_maker/ReadMe.md">building data apps, ("ChartMaker")</a>, which can generate JavaScript from Python.</p></div></details><hr><p dir="auto">📚 <b>Learn about different ways of writing tests:</b></p><p align="left" dir="auto">📘📝 Here's <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/test_simple_login.py">test_simple_login.py</a>, which uses <code><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/fixtures/base_case.py">BaseCase</a></code> class inheritance, and runs with <a href="https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/how-to/usage.html" rel="nofollow">pytest</a> or <a href="https://github.com/mdmintz/pynose">pynose</a>. (Use <code>self.driver</code> to access Selenium's raw <code>driver</code>.)</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" self.type("#last-name", "Automation")        self.type("#postal-code", "77123")        self.click("input#continue")        self.assert_text("Checkout: Overview")        self.assert_text("Backpack", 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">✅ SeleniumBase automatically handles common <a href="https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/webdriver/" rel="nofollow">WebDriver</a> actions such as launching web browsers before tests, saving screenshots during failures, and closing web browsers after tests.</p><p dir="auto">✅ SeleniumBase lets you customize tests via <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/customizing_test_runs.md">command-line options</a>.</p><p dir="auto">✅ SeleniumBase uses simple syntax for commands. Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="self.type("input", "dogs\n")  # (The "\n" presses ENTER)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">type</span>(<span class="pl-s">"input"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"dogs<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>"</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># (The "\n" presses ENTER)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Most SeleniumBase scripts can be run with <code>pytest</code>, <code>pynose</code>, or pure <code>python</code>. Not all test runners can run all test formats. For example, tests that use the <code>sb</code> pytest fixture can only be run with <code>pytest</code>. (See <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/syntax_formats.md">Syntax Formats</a>) There's also a <a href="https://behave.readthedocs.io/en/stable/gherkin.html#features" rel="nofollow">Gherkin</a> test format that runs with <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/behave_bdd/ReadMe.md">behave</a>.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest coffee_cart_tests.py --rspytest test_sb_fixture.py --demopytest test_suite.py --rs --html=report.html --dashboardpynose basic_test.py --mobilepynose test_suite.py --headless --report --show-reportpython raw_sb.pypython raw_test_scripts.pybehave realworld.featurebehave calculator.feature -D rs -D dashboard"><pre>pytest coffee_cart_tests.py --rspytest test_sb_fixture.py --demopytest test_suite.py --rs --html=report.html --dashboardpynose basic_test.py --mobilepynose test_suite.py --headless --report --show-reportpython raw_sb.pypython raw_test_scripts.pybehave realworld.featurebehave calculator.feature -D rs -D dashboard</pre></div><p dir="auto">✅ <code>pytest</code> includes automatic test discovery. If you don't specify a specific file or folder to run, <code>pytest</code> will automatically search through all subdirectories for tests to run based on the following criteria:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Python files that start with <code>test_</code> or end with <code>_test.py</code>.</li><li>Python methods that start with <code>test_</code>.</li></ul><p dir="auto">With a SeleniumBase <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/pytest.ini">pytest.ini</a> file present, you can modify default discovery settings. The Python class name can be anything because <code>seleniumbase.BaseCase</code> inherits <code>unittest.TestCase</code> to trigger autodiscovery.</p><p dir="auto">✅ You can do a pre-flight check to see which tests would get discovered by <code>pytest</code> before the actual run:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest --co -q"><pre>pytest --co -q</pre></div><p dir="auto">✅ You can be more specific when calling <code>pytest</code> or <code>pynose</code> on a file:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest [FILE_NAME.py]::[CLASS_NAME]::[METHOD_NAME]pynose [FILE_NAME.py]:[CLASS_NAME].[METHOD_NAME]"><pre>pytest [FILE_NAME.py]::[CLASS_NAME]::[METHOD_NAME]pynose [FILE_NAME.py]:[CLASS_NAME].[METHOD_NAME]</pre></div><p dir="auto">✅ No More Flaky Tests! SeleniumBase methods automatically wait for page elements to finish loading before interacting with them (<i>up to a timeout limit</i>). This means <b>you no longer need random <span><code>time.sleep()</code></span> statements</b> in your scripts.</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/8a1bd766136cb3422d7a28d41af4021e0a7330af1370bdf461a4cfcc872db434/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f62616467652f466c616b7925323054657374732533462d2532304e4f2532312d3131424244442e737667"><img browsers and operating systems:</p><p dir="auto"><b>Browsers:</b> Chrome, Edge, Firefox, and Safari.</p><p dir="auto"><b>Systems:</b> Linux/Ubuntu, macOS, and Windows.</p><p dir="auto">✅ SeleniumBase Mode</b> helps you see what a test is doing. If a test is moving too fast for your eyes, run it in <b>Demo Mode</b> to pause the browser briefly between actions, highlight page elements being acted on, and display assertions:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest my_first_test.py --demo"><pre>pytest my_first_test.py --demo</pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 <code>time.sleep(seconds)</code> can be used to make a test wait at a specific spot:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import time; time.sleep(3)  # Do nothing for 3 seconds."><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">time</span>; <span class="pl-s1">time</span>.<span class="pl-en">sleep</span>(<span class="pl-c1">3</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Do nothing for 3 seconds.</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 <strong>Debug Mode</strong> with Python's built-in <strong><a href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/pdb.html" rel="nofollow">pdb</a></strong> library helps you debug tests:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import pdb; pdb.set_trace()import pytest; pytest.set_trace()breakpoint()  # Shortcut for "import pdb; pdb.set_trace()""><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">pdb</span>; <span class="pl-s1">pdb</span>.<span class="pl-en">set_trace</span>()<span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">pytest</span>; <span class="pl-s1">pytest</span>.<span class="pl-en">set_trace</span>()<span class="pl-en">breakpoint</span>()  <span class="pl-c"># Shortcut for "import pdb; pdb.set_trace()"</span></pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">(<strong><code>pdb</code></strong> commands: <code>n</code>, <code>c</code>, <code>s</code>, <code>u</code>, <code>d</code> => <code>next</code>, <code>continue</code>, <code>step</code>, <code>up</code>, <code>down</code>)</p></blockquote><p dir="auto">🔵 To pause an active test that throws an exception or error, (<em>and keep the browser window open while <strong>Debug Mode</strong> begins in the console</em>), add <strong><code>--pdb</code></strong> as a <code>pytest</code> option:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_fail.py --pdb"><pre>pytest test_fail.py --pdb</pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 To start tests in Debug Mode, add <strong><code>--trace</code></strong> as a <code>pytest</code> option:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_coffee_cart.py --trace"><pre>pytest test_coffee_cart.py --trace</pre></div><p dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/mdmintz/pdbp"><img id="user-content-pytest_options"></a>✅ Here are some useful command-line options that come with <code>pytest</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="-v  # Verbose mode. Prints the full name of each test and shows more details.-q  # Quiet mode. Print fewer details in the console output when running tests.-x  # Stop running the tests after the first failure is reached.--html=report.html  # Creates a detailed pytest-html report after tests finish.--co | --collect-only  # Show what tests would get run. (Without running them)--co -q  # (Both options together!) - Do a dry run with full test names shown.-n=NUM  # Multithread the tests using that many threads. (Speed up test runs!)-s  # See print statements. (Should be on by default with pytest.ini present.)--junit-xml=report.xml  # Creates a junit-xml report after tests finish.--pdb  # If a test fails, enter Post Mortem Debug Mode. (Don't use with CI!)--trace  # Enter Debug Mode at the beginning of each test. (Don't use with CI!)-m=MARKER  # Run tests with the specified pytest marker."><pre>-v  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Verbose mode. Prints the full name of each test and shows more details.</span>-q  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Quiet mode. Print fewer details in the console output when running tests.</span>-x  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Stop running the tests after the first failure is reached.</span>--html=report.html  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Creates a detailed pytest-html report after tests finish.</span>--co <span class="pl-k">|</span> --collect-only  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Show what tests would get run. (Without running them)</span>--co -q  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Both options together!) - Do a dry run with full test names shown.</span>-n=NUM  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Multithread the tests using that many threads. (Speed up test runs!)</span>-s  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> See print statements. (Should be on by default with pytest.ini present.)</span>--junit-xml=report.xml  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Creates a junit-xml report after tests finish.</span>--pdb  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> If a test fails, enter Post Mortem Debug Mode. (Don't use with CI!)</span>--trace  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Enter Debug Mode at the beginning of each test. (Don't use with CI!)</span>-m=MARKER  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> Run tests with the specified pytest marker.</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><a id="user-content-new_pytest_options"></a>✅ SeleniumBase provides additional <code>pytest</code> command-line options for tests:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="--browser=BROWSER  # (The web browser to use. Default: "chrome".)--chrome  # (Shortcut for "--browser=chrome". On by default.)--edge  # (Shortcut for "--browser=edge".)--firefox  # (Shortcut for "--browser=firefox".)--safari  # (Shortcut for "--browser=safari".)--settings-file=FILE  # (Override default SeleniumBase settings.)--env=ENV  # (Set the test env. Access with "self.env" in tests.)--account=STR  # (Set account. Access with "self.account" in tests.)--data=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with "self.data" in tests.)--var1=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with "self.var1" in tests.)--var2=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with "self.var2" in tests.)--var3=STRING  # (Extra test data. Access with "self.var3" in tests.)--variables=DICT  # (Extra test data. Access with "self.variables".)--user-data-dir=DIR  # (Set the Chrome user data directory to use.)--protocol=PROTOCOL  # (The Selenium Grid protocol: http|https.)--server=SERVER  # (The Selenium Grid server/IP used for tests.)--port=PORT  # (The Selenium Grid port used by the test server.)--cap-file=FILE  # (The web browser's desired capabilities to use.)--cap-string=STRING  # (The web browser's desired capabilities to use.)--proxy=SERVER:PORT  # (Connect to a proxy server:port as tests are running)--proxy=USERNAME:PASSWORD@SERVER:PORT  # (Use an authenticated proxy server)--proxy-bypass-list=STRING # (";"-separated hosts to bypass, Eg "*.foo.com")--proxy-pac-url=URL  # (Connect to a proxy server using a PAC_URL.pac file.)--proxy-pac-url=USERNAME:PASSWORD@URL  # (Authenticated proxy with PAC URL.)--proxy-driver  # (If a driver download is needed, will use: --proxy=PROXY.)--multi-proxy  # (Allow multiple authenticated proxies when multi-threaded.)--agent=STRING  # (Modify the web browser's User-Agent string.)--mobile  # (Use the mobile device emulator while running tests.)--metrics=STRING  # (Set mobile metrics: "CSSWidth,CSSHeight,PixelRatio".)--chromium-arg="ARG=N,ARG2"  # (Set Chromium args, ","-separated, no spaces.)--firefox-arg="ARG=N,ARG2"  # (Set Firefox args, comma-separated, no spaces.)--firefox-pref=SET  # (Set a Firefox preference:value set, comma-separated.)--extension-zip=ZIP  # (Load a Chrome Extension .zip|.crx, comma-separated.)--extension-dir=DIR  # (Load a Chrome Extension directory, comma-separated.)--disable-features="F1,F2"  # (Disable features, comma-separated, no spaces.)--binary-location=PATH  # (Set path of the Chromium browser binary to use.)--driver-version=VER  # (Set the chromedriver or uc_driver version to use.)--sjw  # (Skip JS Waits for readyState to be "complete" or Angular to load.)--pls=PLS  # (Set pageLoadStrategy on Chrome: "normal", "eager", or "none".)--headless  # (Run tests in headless mode. The default arg on Linux OS.)--headless2  # (Use the new headless mode, which supports extensions.)--headed  # (Run tests in headed/GUI mode on Linux OS, where not default.)--xvfb  # (Run tests using the Xvfb virtual display server on Linux OS.)--locale=LOCALE_CODE  # (Set the Language Locale Code for the web browser.)--interval=SECONDS  # (The autoplay interval for presentations & tour steps)--start-page=URL  # (The starting URL for the web browser when tests begin.)--archive-logs  # (Archive existing log files instead of deleting them.)--archive-downloads  # (Archive old downloads instead of deleting them.)--time-limit=SECONDS  # (Safely fail any test that exceeds the time limit.)--slow  # (Slow down the automation. Faster than using Demo Mode.)--demo  # (Slow down and visually see test actions as they occur.)--demo-sleep=SECONDS  # (Set the wait time after Slow & Demo Mode actions.)--highlights=NUM  # (Number of highlight animations for Demo Mode actions.)--message-duration=SECONDS  # (The time length for Messenger alerts.)--check-js  # (Check for JavaScript errors after page loads.)--ad-block  # (Block some types of display ads from loading.)--host-resolver-rules=RULES  # (Set host-resolver-rules, comma-separated.)--block-images  # (Block images from loading during tests.)--do-not-track  # (Indicate to websites that you don't want to be tracked.)--verify-delay=SECONDS  # (The delay before MasterQA verification checks.)--recorder  # (Enables the Recorder for turning browser actions into code.)--rec-behave  # (Same as Recorder Mode, but also generates behave-gherkin.)--rec-sleep  # (If the Recorder is enabled, also records self.sleep calls.)--rec-print  # (If the Recorder is enabled, prints output after tests end.)--disable-js  # (Disable JavaScript on websites. Pages might break!)--disable-csp  # (Disable the Content Security Policy of websites.)--disable-ws  # (Disable Web Security on Chromium-based browsers.)--enable-ws  # (Enable Web Security on Chromium-based browsers.)--enable-sync  # (Enable "Chrome Sync" on websites.)--uc | --undetected  # (Use undetected-chromedriver to evade bot-detection.)--uc-cdp-events  # (Capture CDP events when running in "--undetected" mode.)--log-cdp  # ("goog:loggingPrefs", {"performance": "ALL", "browser": "ALL"})--remote-debug  # (Sync to Chrome Remote Debugger chrome://inspect/#devices)--ftrace | --final-trace  # (Debug Mode after each test. Don't use with CI!)--dashboard  # (Enable the SeleniumBase Dashboard. Saved at: dashboard.html)--dash-title=STRING  # (Set the title shown for the generated dashboard.)--enable-3d-apis  # (Enables WebGL and 3D APIs.)--swiftshader  # (Chrome "--use-gl=angle" / "--use-angle=swiftshader-webgl")--incognito  # (Enable Chrome's Incognito mode.)--guest  # (Enable Chrome's Guest mode.)--dark  # (Enable Chrome's Dark mode.)--devtools  # (Open Chrome's DevTools when the browser opens.)--rs | --reuse-session  # (Reuse browser session for all tests.)--rcs | --reuse-class-session  # (Reuse session for tests in class.)--crumbs  # (Delete all cookies between tests reusing a session.)--disable-beforeunload  # (Disable the "beforeunload" event on Chrome.)--window-size=WIDTH,HEIGHT  # (Set the browser's starting window size.)--maximize  # (Start tests with the browser window maximized.)--screenshot  # (Save a screenshot at the end of each test.)--no-screenshot  # (No screenshots saved unless tests directly ask it.)--visual-baseline  # (Set the visual baseline for Visual/Layout tests.)--wire  # (Use selenium-wire's webdriver for replacing selenium webdriver.)--external-pdf  # (Set Chromium "plugins.always_open_pdf_externally":True.)--timeout-multiplier=MULTIPLIER  # (Multiplies the default timeout values.)--list-fail-page  # (After each failing test, list the URL of the failure.)"><pre>--browser=BROWSER  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (The web browser to use. Pages might break!)</span>--disable-csp  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Disable the Content Security Policy of websites.)</span>--disable-ws  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Disable Web Security on Chromium-based browsers.)</span>--enable-ws  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Enable Web Security on Chromium-based browsers.)</span>--enable-sync  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Enable "Chrome Sync" on websites.)</span>--uc <span class="pl-k">|</span> --undetected  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Use undetected-chromedriver to evade bot-detection.)</span>--uc-cdp-events  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Capture CDP events when running in "--undetected" mode.)</span>--log-cdp  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> ("goog:loggingPrefs", {"performance": "ALL", "browser": "ALL"})</span>--remote-debug  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Sync to Chrome Remote Debugger chrome://inspect/#devices)</span>--ftrace <span class="pl-k">|</span> --final-trace  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Debug Mode after each test. class="pl-k">|</span> --reuse-session  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Reuse browser session for all tests.)</span>--rcs <span class="pl-k">|</span> --reuse-class-session  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Reuse session for tests in class.)</span>--crumbs  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Delete all cookies between tests reusing a session.)</span>--disable-beforeunload  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Disable the "beforeunload" event on Chrome.)</span>--window-size=WIDTH,HEIGHT  <span class="pl-c"><span <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Save a screenshot at the end of each test.)</span>--no-screenshot  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (No screenshots saved unless tests directly ask it.)</span>--visual-baseline  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Set the visual baseline for Visual/Layout tests.)</span>--wire  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Use selenium-wire's webdriver for replacing selenium webdriver.)</span>--external-pdf  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Set Chromium "plugins.always_open_pdf_externally":True.)</span>--timeout-multiplier=MULTIPLIER  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (Multiplies the default timeout values.)</span>--list-fail-page  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> (After each failing test, list the URL of the failure.)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">(See the full list of command-line option definitions <strong><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/plugins/pytest_plugin.py">here</a></strong>. For detailed examples of command-line options, see <strong><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/customizing_test_runs.md">customizing_test_runs.md</a></strong>)</p><hr><p dir="auto">🔵 During test failures, logs and screenshots from the most recent test run will get saved to the <code>latest_logs/</code> folder. Those logs will get moved to <code>archived_logs/</code> if you add --archive_logs to command-line options, or have <code>ARCHIVE_EXISTING_LOGS</code> set to True in <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/settings.py">settings.py</a>, otherwise log files with be cleaned up at the start of the next test run. The <code>test_suite.py</code> collection contains tests that fail on purpose so that you can see how logging works.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="cd examples/pytest test_suite.py --chromepytest test_suite.py --firefox"><pre><span class="pl-c1">cd</span> examples/pytest test_suite.py --chromepytest test_suite.py --firefox</pre></div><p dir="auto">An easy way to override seleniumbase/config/settings.py is by using a custom settings file.Here's the command-line option to add to tests: (See <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/custom_settings.py">examples/custom_settings.py</a>)<code>--settings_file=custom_settings.py</code>(Settings include default timeout values, a two-factor auth key, DB credentials, S3 credentials, and other important settings used by tests.)</p><p dir="auto">🔵 To pass additional data from the command-line to tests, add <code>--data="ANY STRING"</code>.Inside your tests, you can use <code>self.data</code> to access that.</p><p dir="auto"><a id="user-content-directory_configuration"></a></p><div 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">🔵 When running tests with <strong><code>pytest</code></strong>, you'll want a copy of <strong><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/pytest.ini">pytest.ini</a></strong> in your root folders. When running tests with <strong><code>pynose</code></strong>, you'll want a copy of <strong><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/setup.cfg">setup.cfg</a></strong> in your root folders. These files specify default configuration details for tests. Test folders should also include a blank <strong><a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/offline_examples/__init__.py"><strong>init</strong>.py</a></strong> file to allow your test files to import other files from that folder.</p><p dir="auto">🔵 <code>sbase mkdir DIR</code> creates a folder with config files and sample tests:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="sbase mkdir ui_tests"><pre>sbase mkdir ui_tests</pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">That new folder will have these files:</p></blockquote><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ui_tests/├── __init__.py├── my_first_test.py├── parameterized_test.py├── pytest.ini├── requirements.txt├── setup.cfg├── test_demo_site.py└── boilerplates/    ├── __init__.py    ├── base_test_case.py    ├── boilerplate_test.py    ├── classic_obj_test.py    ├── page_objects.py    ├── sb_fixture_test.py    └── samples/        ├── __init__.py        ├── google_objects.py        ├── google_test.py        ├── sb_swag_test.py        └── swag_labs_test.py"><pre>ui_tests/├── __init__.py├── my_first_test.py├── parameterized_test.py├── pytest.ini├── requirements.txt├── setup.cfg├── test_demo_site.py└── boilerplates/    ├── __init__.py    ├── base_test_case.py    ├── boilerplate_test.py    ├── classic_obj_test.py    ├── page_objects.py    ├── sb_fixture_test.py    └── samples/        ├── __init__.py        ├── google_objects.py        ├── google_test.py        ├── sb_swag_test.py        └── swag_labs_test.py</pre></div><p dir="auto"><b>ProTip™:</b> You can also create a boilerplate folder without any sample tests in it by adding <code>-b</code> or <code>--basic</code> to the <code>sbase mkdir</code> command:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="sbase mkdir ui_tests --basic"><pre>sbase mkdir ui_tests --basic</pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">That new folder will have these files:</p></blockquote><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ui_tests/├── __init__.py├── pytest.ini├── requirements.txt└── setup.cfg"><pre>ui_tests/├── __init__.py├── pytest.ini├── requirements.txt└── setup.cfg</pre></div><p dir="auto">Of those files, the <code>pytest.ini</code> config file is the most important, followed by a blank <code>__init__.py</code> file. There's also a <code>setup.cfg</code> file (for pynose). Finally, the <code>requirements.txt</code> file can be used to help you install seleniumbase into your environments (if it's not already installed).</p><hr><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow"
