data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="""" test_fail.py """from seleniumbase import BaseCaseBaseCase.main(__name__, __file__)class MyTestClass(BaseCase):    def test_find_army_of_robots_on_xkcd_desert_island(self):        self.open("https://xkcd.com/731/")        self.assert_element("div#ARMY_OF_ROBOTS", timeout=1)  # This should fail"><pre><span class="pl-s">""" test_fail.py """</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">seleniumbase</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span><span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span>.<span class="pl-en">main</span>(<span class="pl-s1">__name__</span>, <span class="pl-s1">__file__</span>)<span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">MyTestClass</span>(<span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span>):    <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">test_find_army_of_robots_on_xkcd_desert_island</span>(<span class="pl-s1">self</span>):        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">open</span>(<span class="pl-s">"https://xkcd.com/731/"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">assert_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">"div#ARMY_OF_ROBOTS"</span>, <span class="pl-s1">timeout</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># This should fail</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can run it from the <code>examples/</code> folder like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_fail.py"><pre>pytest test_fail.py</pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 You'll notice that a logs folder, "latest_logs", was created to hold information about the failing test, and screenshots. During test runs, past results get moved to the archived_logs folder if you have ARCHIVE_EXISTING_LOGS set to True in <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/settings.py">settings.py</a>, or if your run tests with <code>--archive-logs</code>. If you choose not to archive existing logs, they will be deleted and replaced by the logs of the latest test run.</p><hr><p dir="auto"><a id="user-content-seleniumbase_dashboard"></a></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/c1616b3f75f1547e5cb761956f71aa3317b93ef99ea41ac878a90f32ab178dac/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f696d672f6c6f676f372e706e67"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/c1616b3f75f1547e5cb761956f71aa3317b93ef99ea41ac878a90f32ab178dac/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f696d672f6c6f676f372e706e67" title="SeleniumBase" width="32" data-canonical-src="https://seleniumbase.github.io/img/logo7.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> SeleniumBase Dashboard:</h2><a id="user-content--seleniumbase-dashboard" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink:  SeleniumBase Dashboard:" href="#-seleniumbase-dashboard"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">🔵 The <code>--dashboard</code> option for pytest generates a SeleniumBase Dashboard located at <code>dashboard.html</code>, which updates automatically as tests run and produce results. Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest --dashboard --rs --headless"><pre>pytest --dashboard --rs --headless</pre></div><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d3362b2f52ebc4545d89b8c8418402d2b39990a1c218fb2038573bf5e4983e60/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f64617368626f6172645f312e706e67"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d3362b2f52ebc4545d89b8c8418402d2b39990a1c218fb2038573bf5e4983e60/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f64617368626f6172645f312e706e67" alt="The SeleniumBase Dashboard" title="The SeleniumBase Dashboard" width="380" data-canonical-src="https://seleniumbase.github.io/cdn/img/dashboard_1.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">🔵 Additionally, you can host your own SeleniumBase Dashboard Server on a port of your choice. Here's an example of that using Python's <code>http.server</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="python -m http.server 1948"><pre>python -m http.server 1948</pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 Now you can navigate to <code>http://localhost:1948/dashboard.html</code> in order to view the dashboard as a web app. This requires two different terminal windows: one for running the server, and another for running the tests, which should be run from the same directory. (Use <kbd>Ctrl+C</kbd> to stop the http server.)</p><p dir="auto">🔵 Here's a full example of what the SeleniumBase Dashboard may look like:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_suite.py test_image_saving.py --dashboard --rs --headless"><pre>pytest test_suite.py test_image_saving.py rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/b821863c8b98cf4f32243b844baae7968be51c3ed796077c17f7feefceb7042b/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f68746d6c5f7265706f72742e706e67"><img alt="Example Pytest Report" title="Example Pytest Report" width="520" data-canonical-src="https://seleniumbase.github.io/cdn/img/html_report.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">✅ When combining pytest html reports with SeleniumBase Dashboard usage, the pie chart from the Dashboard will get added to the html report. Additionally, if you set the html report URL to be the same as the Dashboard URL when also using the dashboard, (example: <code>--dashboard --html=dashboard.html</code>), then the Dashboard will become an advanced html report when all the tests complete.</p><p dir="auto">✅ Here's an example of an upgraded html report:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_suite.py --dashboard --html=report.html"><pre>pytest test_suite.py --dashboard --html=report.html</pre></div><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e74185ef8eeb167f31b51b7aa3dbd8ebd8c21d5a876776162e1042c239b4367b/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f646173685f7265706f72742e6a7067"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e74185ef8eeb167f31b51b7aa3dbd8ebd8c21d5a876776162e1042c239b4367b/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f63646e2f696d672f646173685f7265706f72742e6a7067" alt="Dashboard Pytest HTML Report" title="Dashboard Pytest HTML Report" width="520" data-canonical-src="https://seleniumbase.github.io/cdn/img/dash_report.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">If viewing pytest html reports in <a href="https://www.jenkins.io/" rel="nofollow">Jenkins</a>, you may need to <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/a/46197356" rel="nofollow">configure Jenkins settings</a> for the html to render correctly. This is due to <a href="https://www.jenkins.io/doc/book/system-administration/security/configuring-content-security-policy/" rel="nofollow">Jenkins CSP changes</a>.</p><p dir="auto">You can also use <code>--junit-xml=report.xml</code> to get an xml report instead. Jenkins can use this file to display better reporting for your tests.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_suite.py --junit-xml=report.xml"><pre>pytest test_suite.py --junit-xml=report.xml</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" If you want to use it, install it first:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install allure-pytest"><pre>pip install allure-pytest</pre></div><p dir="auto">Now your tests can create Allure results files, which can be processed by Allure Reports.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest test_suite.py --alluredir=allure_results"><pre>pytest test_suite.py --alluredir=allure_results</pre></div><hr><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink:  Using a Proxy Server:" href="#-using-a-proxy-server"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" to use a proxy server for your browser tests (Chromium or Firefox), you can add <code>--proxy=IP_ADDRESS:PORT</code> as an argument on the command line.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=IP_ADDRESS:PORT"><pre>pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=IP_ADDRESS:PORT</pre></div><p dir="auto">If the proxy server that you wish to use requires authentication, you can do the following (Chromium only):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=USERNAME:PASSWORD@IP_ADDRESS:PORT"><pre>pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=USERNAME:PASSWORD@IP_ADDRESS:PORT</pre></div><p dir="auto">SeleniumBase also supports SOCKS4 and SOCKS5 proxies:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest proxy_test.py --proxy="socks4://IP_ADDRESS:PORT"pytest proxy_test.py --proxy="socks5://IP_ADDRESS:PORT""><pre>pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>socks4://IP_ADDRESS:PORT<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>socks5://IP_ADDRESS:PORT<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">To make things easier, you can add your frequently-used proxies to PROXY_LIST in <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/proxy_list.py">proxy_list.py</a>, and then use <code>--proxy=KEY_FROM_PROXY_LIST</code> to use the IP_ADDRESS:PORT of that key.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=proxy1"><pre>pytest proxy_test.py --proxy=proxy1</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a target="_blank" automatically waits for and dismisses alert pop-ups. On occasion, some methods like <code>self.click(SELECTOR)</code> might dismiss a pop-up on its own because they call JavaScript to make sure that the <code>readyState</code> of the page is <code>complete</code> before advancing. If you're trying to accept a pop-up that got dismissed this way, use this workaround: Call <code>self.find_element(SELECTOR).click()</code> instead, (which will let the pop-up remain on the screen), and then use <code>self.accept_alert()</code> to accept the pop-up (<a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/issues/600#issuecomment-647270426" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/issues/600/hovercard">more on that here</a>). If pop-ups are intermittent, wrap code in a try/except block.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/c1616b3f75f1547e5cb761956f71aa3317b93ef99ea41ac878a90f32ab178dac/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f696d672f6c6f676f372e706e67"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/c1616b3f75f1547e5cb761956f71aa3317b93ef99ea41ac878a90f32ab178dac/68747470733a2f2f73656c656e69756d626173652e6769746875622e696f2f696d672f6c6f676f372e706e67" title="SeleniumBase" width="32" data-canonical-src="https://seleniumbase.github.io/img/logo7.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> Building Guided Tours for Websites:</h3><a id="user-content--building-guided-tours-for-websites" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink:  Building Guided Tours for Websites:" href="#-building-guided-tours-for-websites"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">🔵 Learn about <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/examples/tour_examples/ReadMe.md">SeleniumBase Interactive Walkthroughs</a> (in the <code>examples/tour_examples/</code> folder). (<b>click to expand</b>)</summary><ul dir="auto"><li>You can set up a <a href="https://jenkins.io/" rel="nofollow">Jenkins</a> build server for running tests at regular intervals. For a real-world Jenkins example of headless browser automation in action, check out the <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/integrations/azure/jenkins/ReadMe.md">SeleniumBase Jenkins example on Azure</a> or the <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/integrations/google_cloud/ReadMe.md">SeleniumBase Jenkins example on Google Cloud</a>.</li><li>You can use <a href="https://selenium.dev/documentation/en/grid/" rel="nofollow">the Selenium Grid</a> to scale your testing by distributing tests on several machines with parallel execution. To do this, check out the <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/tree/master/seleniumbase/utilities/selenium_grid">SeleniumBase selenium_grid folder</a>, which should have everything you need, including the <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/utilities/selenium_grid/ReadMe.md">Selenium Grid ReadMe</a> to help you get started.</li><li>If you're using the <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/help_docs/mysql_installation.md">SeleniumBase MySQL feature</a> to save results from tests running on a server machine, you can install <a href="https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/tools/workbench/" rel="nofollow">MySQL Workbench</a> to help you read & write from your DB more easily.</li><li>If you're using AWS, you can set up an <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/s3/" rel="nofollow">Amazon S3</a> account for saving log files and screenshots from your tests. To activate this feature, modify <a href="https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase/blob/master/seleniumbase/config/settings.py">settings.py</a> with connection details in the S3 section, and add <code>--with-s3-logging</code> on the command-line when running your tests.</li></ul><p dir="auto">Here's an example of running tests with some additional features enabled:</p><div class="highlight (SeleniumBase automatically switches to new tabs that don't open to <code>about:blank</code> URLs.)</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="self.switch_to_window(1)  # This switches to the new tab (0 is the first one)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_window</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># This switches to the new tab (0 is the first one)</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🔵 How to handle iframes:</h3><a id="user-content--how-to-handle-iframes" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: 🔵 How to handle iframes:" href="#-how-to-handle-iframes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">🔵 <b>iframes</b> follow the same principle as new windows: You must first switch to the iframe if you want to perform actions in there:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="self.switch_to_frame("iframe")# ... Now perform actions inside the iframeself.switch_to_parent_frame()  # Exit the current iframe"><pre><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_frame</span>(<span class="pl-s">"iframe"</span>)<span class="pl-c"># ... Now perform actions inside the iframe</span><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_parent_frame</span>()  <span class="pl-c"># Exit the current iframe</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">To exit from multiple iframes, use <code>self.switch_to_default_content()</code>. (If inside a single iframe, this has the same effect as <code>self.switch_to_parent_frame()</code>.)</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="self.switch_to_frame('iframe[name="frame1"]')self.switch_to_frame('iframe[name="frame2"]')# ... Now perform actions inside the inner iframeself.switch_to_default_content()  # Back to the main page"><pre><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_frame</span>(<span class="pl-s">'iframe[name="frame1"]'</span>)<span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_frame</span>(<span class="pl-s">'iframe[name="frame2"]'</span>)<span class="pl-c"># ... Now perform actions inside the inner iframe</span><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">switch_to_default_content</span>()  <span class="pl-c"># Back to the main page</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">🔵 You can also use a context manager to act inside iframes:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="with self.frame_switch("iframe"):    # ... Now perform actions while inside the code block# You have left the iframe"><pre><span class="pl-k">with</span> <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">frame_switch</span>(<span class="pl-s">"iframe"</span>):    <span class="pl-c"># ... Now perform actions while inside the code block</span><span class="pl-c"># You have left the iframe</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This also works with nested iframes:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="with self.frame_switch('iframe[name="frame1"]'):    with self.frame_switch('iframe[name="frame2"]'):        # ... Now perform actions while inside the code block    # You are now back inside the first iframe# You have left all the iframes"><pre><span class="pl-k">with</span> <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">frame_switch</span>(<span class="pl-s">'iframe[name="frame1"]'</span>):    <span class="pl-k">with</span> <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">frame_switch</span>(<span class="pl-s">'iframe[name="frame2"]'</span>):        <span class="pl-c"># ... Now perform actions while inside the code block</span>    <span class="pl-c"># You are now back inside the first iframe</span><span class="pl-c"># You have left all the iframes</span></pre></div><div To do so, run the following command first:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="self.activate_jquery()"><pre><span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">activate_jquery</span>()</pre></div><div dir="auto"></div><details><summary> <g-emoji class="g-emoji" alias="arrow_forward">▶️</g-emoji> Here are some examples of using jQuery in your scripts. users from loading jQuery and other external libraries onto their websites. If you need to use jQuery or another JS library on those websites, add <code>--disable-csp</code> as a <code>pytest</code> command-line option to load a Chromium extension that bypasses the CSP.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🔵 More JavaScript fun:</h3><a id="user-content--more-javascript-fun" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: 🔵 More JavaScript fun:" href="#-more-javascript-fun"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><div dir="auto"></div><details><summary> <g-emoji class="g-emoji" alias="arrow_forward">▶️</g-emoji> In this example, JavaScript creates a referral button on a page, which is then clicked. class="pl-cce">\"</span>'''</span> <span class="pl-c1">%</span> <span class="pl-s1">referral_link</span>)<span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">click</span>(<span class="pl-s">"a.analytics"</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Clicks the generated button</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">(Due to popular demand, this traffic generation example has been included in SeleniumBase with the <code>self.generate_referral(start_page, end_page)</code> and the <code>self.generate_traffic(start_page, end_page, loops)</code> methods.)</p></details><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🔵 How to use deferred asserts:</h3><a id="user-content--how-to-use-deferred-asserts" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: 🔵 How to use deferred asserts:" href="#-how-to-use-deferred-asserts"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Let's say you want to verify multiple different elements on a web page in a single test, but you don't want the test to fail until you verified several elements at once so that you don't have to rerun the test to find more missing elements on the same page. That's where deferred asserts come in. Here's an example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from seleniumbase import BaseCaseBaseCase.main(__name__, __file__)class DeferredAssertTests(BaseCase):    def test_deferred_asserts(self):        self.open("https://xkcd.com/993/")        self.wait_for_element("#comic")        self.deferred_assert_element('img[alt="Brand Identity"]')        self.deferred_assert_element('img[alt="Rocket Ship"]')  # Will Fail        self.deferred_assert_element("#comicmap")        self.deferred_assert_text("Fake Item", "ul.comicNav")  # Will Fail        self.deferred_assert_text("Random", "ul.comicNav")        self.deferred_assert_element('a[name="Super Fake !!!"]')  # Will Fail        self.deferred_assert_exact_text("Brand Identity", "#ctitle")        self.deferred_assert_exact_text("Fake Food", "#comic")  # Will Fail        self.process_deferred_asserts()"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">seleniumbase</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span><span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span>.<span class="pl-en">main</span>(<span class="pl-s1">__name__</span>, <span class="pl-s1">__file__</span>)<span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">DeferredAssertTests</span>(<span class="pl-v">BaseCase</span>):    <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">test_deferred_asserts</span>(<span class="pl-s1">self</span>):        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">open</span>(<span class="pl-s">"https://xkcd.com/993/"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">wait_for_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">"#comic"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">'img[alt="Brand Identity"]'</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">'img[alt="Rocket Ship"]'</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Will Fail</span>        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">"#comicmap"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_text</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Fake Item"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"ul.comicNav"</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Will Fail</span>        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_text</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Random"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"ul.comicNav"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_element</span>(<span class="pl-s">'a[name="Super Fake !!!"]'</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Will Fail</span>        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_exact_text</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Brand Identity"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"#ctitle"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">deferred_assert_exact_text</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Fake Food"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"#comic"</span>)  <span class="pl-c"># Will Fail</span>        <span class="pl-s1">self</span>.<span class="pl-en">process_deferred_asserts</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto"><code>deferred_assert_element()</code> and <code>deferred_assert_text()</code> will save any exceptions that would be raised.To flush out all the failed deferred asserts into a single exception, make sure to call <code>self.process_deferred_asserts()</code> at the end of your test method. If your test hits multiple pages, you can call <code>self.process_deferred_asserts()</code> before navigating to a new page so that the screenshot from your log files matches the URL where the deferred asserts were made.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🔵 How to access raw <a retry failing tests that many times. Add <code>--reruns-delay=SECONDS</code> to wait that many seconds between retries. Example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pytest --reruns=1 --reruns-delay=1"><pre>pytest --reruns=1 --reruns-delay=1</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can use the <code>@retry_on_exception()</code> decorator to retry failing methods. (First import: <code>from seleniumbase import decorators</code>).
